summary: A utility that walks a parse tree from the leaves upward, invoking user‑defined callbacks for each node type to produce a new tree (or modify the existing one). It automatically handles missing callbacks by copying nodes and allows nodes to be removed by returning a discard marker. Optional token visitation and in‑place variants give flexibility for performance and mutation strategies.
business_intent: Enable developers to implement custom transformations, optimizations, or analyses on syntax trees generated by a parser, supporting map/reduce style processing and easy integration into language tooling or data pipelines.
